sentence.Network_en: The radio said other parts of the capital also came under shellfire.
sentence.Network_cn: 广播上说首都的其他地区也遭到了炮火袭击。

sentence.Network_en: Light fittings with metal parts should always be earthed.
sentence.Network_cn: 有金属部件的照明装置都应该走地线。

sentence.Network_en: Communal violence broke out in different parts of the country.
sentence.Network_cn: 在该国不同的地区发生了群体暴力事件。

collins.item: NOUN USES, QUANTIFIER USES, AND PHRASES
collins.tran: 名词用法、量词用法及短语

entry.def: A part of something is one of the pieces, sections, or elements that it consists of.

example.ex: I like that part of Cape Town...
example.tran: 我喜欢开普敦的那片地方。

example.ex: Respect is a very important part of any relationship.
example.tran: 尊重是任何关系中都非常重要的部分。

entry.def: A part for a machine or vehicle is one of the smaller pieces that is used to make it.

example.ex: ...spare parts for military equipment...
example.tran: 军事装备的备用零件

example.ex: This engine has only got three moving parts.
example.tran: 这台发动机只有3个活动部件。

entry.def: Part of something is some of it.

example.ex: It was a very severe accident and he lost part of his foot...
example.tran: 那是一场非常严重的事故，他有一只脚残废了。

example.ex: Mum and he were able to walk part of the way together...
example.tran: 妈妈和他能够一起走一段路。

entry.def: If you say that something is part one thing, part another, you mean that it is to some extent the first thing and to some extent the second thing.

example.ex: The television producer today has to be part news person, part educator...
example.tran: 今天的电视制片人必须既是新闻人，又是教育者。

example.ex: Several people looked over the part-Jacobean, part-Georgian building.
example.tran: 几个人查看了那栋半詹姆士一世时期风格、半乔治王朝风格的大楼。

entry.def: You can use part when you are talking about the proportions of substances in a mixture. For example, if you are told to use five parts water to one part paint, the mixture should contain five times as much water as paint.

example.ex: Use turpentine and linseed oil, three parts to two.
example.tran: 用松节油和亚麻油，比例为3:2。

entry.def: A part in a play or film is one of the roles in it which an actor or actress can perform.

example.ex: Alf Sjoberg offered her a large part in the play he was directing...
example.tran: 阿尔夫·肖博格让她在其导演的戏中扮演重要角色。

example.ex: He was just right for the part.
example.tran: 他是那个角色的不二人选。

entry.def: Your part in something that happens is your involvement in it.

example.ex: If only he could conceal his part in the accident...
example.tran: 要是他能够隐瞒住自己在这场事故中的责任就好了。

example.ex: He felt a sense of relief that his part in this business was now over.
example.tran: 现在不再参与这门生意了，他如释重负。

entry.def: If something or someone is part of a group or organization, they belong to it or are included in it.

example.ex: ...voting on whether to remain part of the Union or become independent...
example.tran: 决定是留在联盟内还是独立的投票

example.ex: I was a part of the team and wanted to remain a part of the team.
example.tran: 我是队伍的一员，希望留在这个队伍中。

entry.def: The part in someone's hair is the line running from the front to the back of their head where their hair lies in different directions.

example.ex: The straight white part in her ebony hair seemed to divide the back of her head in half.
example.tran: 她乌黑的头发中有条笔直的白色分缝，仿佛将她的后脑勺一分为二。

entry.def: If something or someone plays a large or important part in an event or situation, they are very involved in it and have an important effect on what happens.

example.ex: These days work plays an important part in a single woman's life...
example.tran: 现在，工作在单身女性的生活中起着重要作用。

example.ex: We believe she may have played a part in hiding the cash.
example.tran: 我们认为她可能参与了藏匿现金。

entry.def: If you take part in an activity, you do it together with other people.

example.ex: Thousands of students have taken part in demonstrations.
example.tran: 数千学生参加了游行。

entry.def: If you say that you want no part of something, you mean that you do not want to be involved in it at all.

example.ex: What some other clubs do is unfortunate, but we want no part of it.
example.tran: 其他一些俱乐部的所作所为令人遗憾，但是我们不愿介入。

entry.tran: 在（某人）看来；就（某人）而言
entry.def: When you are describing people's thoughts or actions, you can say for her part or for my part, for example, to introduce what a particular person thinks or does.

example.ex: For my part, I feel elated and close to tears...
example.tran: 就我而言，我感到非常高兴，都快落泪了。

example.ex: The soldiers, for their part, agreed not to disrupt the election campaign.
example.tran: 就士兵们而言，他们答应不去干扰竞选活动。

entry.def: If you talk about a feeling or action on someone's part, you are referring to something that they feel or do.

example.ex: ...techniques on their part to keep us from knowing exactly what's going on...
example.tran: 他们所采取的防止我们知道具体发生什么事情的手段

example.ex: There is no need for any further instructions on my part...
example.tran: 我没有必要再作进一步的指导。

entry.def: For the most part means mostly or usually.

example.ex: For the most part the Germans kept out of local disputes...
example.tran: 德国人通常不卷入地区冲突。

example.ex: Professors, for the most part, are firmly committed to teaching, not research.
example.tran: 大多数教授都投身于教学，而不是研究。

entry.def: You use in part to indicate that something exists or happens to some extent but not completely.

example.ex: The levels of blood glucose depend in part on what you eat and when you eat...
example.tran: 血糖水平在某种程度上取决于饮食内容和时间。

example.ex: In part this attitude was due to fear of trade union and employee reactions.
example.tran: 在某种程度上，这一态度是由于害怕工会和雇员的反应。

entry.def: If you say that something happened for the best part or the better part of a period of time, you mean that it happened for most of that time.

example.ex: He had been in Israel for the best part of twenty-four hours...
example.tran: 他一天24小时多数时间在以色列。

example.ex: We spent the better part of an hour searching for her.
example.tran: 我们花了近1个小时找她。

entry.def: If things that are next to each other part or if you part them, they move in opposite directions, so that there is a space between them.

example.ex: Her lips parted as if she were about to take a deep breath...
example.tran: 她张开嘴，好像要深呼吸。

example.ex: He crossed to the window of the sitting-room and parted the curtains.
example.tran: 他走到客厅窗户边，拉开了窗帘。

entry.def: If you part your hair in the middle or at one side, you make it lie in two different directions so that there is a straight line running from the front of your head to the back.

example.ex: Picking up a brush, Joanna parted her hair...
example.tran: 乔安娜拿起一把刷子，给头发分缝。

example.ex: His hair was slicked back and neatly parted.
example.tran: 他梳着锃亮的大背头，缝分得很整齐。

entry.def: When two people part, or if one person parts from another, they leave each other.

example.ex: He gave me the envelope and we parted...
example.tran: 他给了我那个信封，我们就告别了。

example.ex: He has confirmed he is parting from his Swedish-born wife Eva.
example.tran: 他承认要与他的瑞典妻子伊娃分手。

entry.def: If you are parted from someone you love, you are prevented from being with them.

example.ex: I don't believe Lotte and I will ever be parted...
example.tran: 我相信洛特和我永远都不会分开。

example.ex: A stay in hospital may be the first time a child is ever parted from its parents.
example.tran: 住院可能是孩子第一次与父母分开。

sentences.sentence: "he hasn't been seen around these parts in years"

auth_sentence.content: They are greater than the sum of their parts.
auth_sentence.res_content: They are greater than the sum of their parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They are greater than the sum of their parts.

auth_sentence.content: Such idle banter holds no water in these parts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such idle banter holds no water in these parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such idle banter holds no water in these parts.

auth_sentence.content: Realists seem to be rarefied, in these parts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Realists seem to be rarefied, in these parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Realists seem to be rarefied, in these parts.

Sentence.sentence: Sometimes a new technology doesn't drive the old one out, but only parts of it while forcing the rest to evolve.
Movies did, however, fatally impact some parts of live theater
By reviewing only the marked parts.
They can only survive in parts of the Americas.
I am responsible for financial development programs in many parts of the world, so forecasting long range trends and making predictions on the basis of present evidence is what I do.
After a long period, alcoholism can deteriorate the liver, the brain and other parts of the body
